TYRANT.Definition: a ruler who governed with unlimited power and was not just

RIGGED.Definition: arranged in a dishonest way so that he could affect the result

BEGRUDGINGLY.Definition: without wanting to do it, reluctantly

MISSION.Definition: an organisation with the goal to go out into the world and spread their faith

PROTECTORATES.Definition: countries that were controlled by some other more powerful country

ROLE MODELS.Definition: people to admire and try to behave like

FOUND COMMON GROUND.Definition: found that they had things in common

BREEDING GROUND.Definition: the place where it was promoted

SOFTEN.Definition: make them less intense or severe

DISPLACED.Definition: forced them to leave their homes

POLITICAL SPECTRUM.Definition: range of political views or opinions

RADICAL.Definition: expressing the belief that there should be extreme political change

DISOBEDIENCES.Definition: acts of people refusing to obey the law

EXPLOITERS.Definition: people who used others in an unfair way for personal gain

BOYCOTTED.Definition: they didn't take part in it

ACRONYMS.Definition: words formed from the first letters of each word of a phrase

CULMINATED.Definition: reached the point of its highest development

OPPRESSED.Definition: treated them in an unfair or bad way

OPPRESS.Definition: treat them in an unfair or bad way

COALITION.Definition: temporary alliance or union for political reasons

LITERACY RATE.Definition: the percentage of the population that could read and write

IMMUNISATION.Definition: the action of making them immune or resistant to disease

CORRUPTS.Definition: causes people to behave in a dishonest way for personal benefits

ATROCITY.Definition: an extremely violent and shocking act

GENOCIDE.Definition: the crime of killing a part of a national group

CONSTITUTION.Definition: the set of political ideas and laws according to which a state is governed

SURPRISE, SURPRISE.Definition: used to say in a joking way that it was not surprising at all

VOTER INTIMIDATION.Definition: making the people who voted be filled with fear

EXCESS.Definition: the action of spending more than necessary

PAY RISES.Definition: increases in the amount of money they were receiving

TENSIONS.Definition: periods of bad relations or hostility

FAMINE.Definition: a situation in which there wasn't enough food

ABDUCTIONS.Definition: acts of taking people away by force

INTIMIDATION.Definition: actions of filling people with fear

IN FREEFALL.Definition: getting worse and worse very quickly

RECOUNT.Definition: the act of counting the votes again

BALLOTS.Definition: pieces of paper used to record people's vote

SUSPICIOUS.Definition: making people feel that something illegal was happening

SUCCEED.Definition: take his position after his death

INFIGHTING.Definition: competition between people of his group

RANKS.Definition: people who belonged to that group

SUCCESSORS.Definition: people who could take his position after his death

ELECTORAL SYSTEM.Definition: method and rules of counting votes during elections

EXODUS.Definition: movement of a lot of people

IRONICALLY.Definition: in a way that is interesting because of being very different from what we would expect

OVERSHADOWED.Definition: caused it to be less important

DICTATOR.Definition: a leader with complete power, absolute ruler

AFFECTIONATELY.Definition: in a way that showed love or sympathy

FALLS FROM GRACE.Definition: losses of positions of power or honour
